formattedAddress: Located in, Performing Arts Center, 251 Fulton St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: Located in, Performing Arts Center, 251 Fulton St, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text: Six of us came here on a Saturday night and lived this restaurant! It’s a few months old and not a lot of people know about it yet, so we were able to easily get a reservation, but you could have also walked in as there were many open tables. My favorite dish was the cheese ravioli, but I enjoyed everything else that we got. The desserts are outstanding, so it’s worth coming here just for that. The desserts were hands down Michelin star level!

text.text: Six of us came here on a Saturday night and lived this restaurant! It’s a few months old and not a lot of people know about it yet, so we were able to easily get a reservation, but you could have also walked in as there were many open tables. My favorite dish was the cheese ravioli, but I enjoyed everything else that we got. The desserts are outstanding, so it’s worth coming here just for that. The desserts were hands down Michelin star level!

originalText.text: The new restaurant by Marcus Samuelsson is definitely a worthwhile destination for a beautiful meal. The atmosphere, presentation of the food and cocktail menu was phenomenal.  The wood was good, but I definitely expected to be blown-away by the quality and taste-profile. I tried a few things on the menu; the oysters were interesting but not worth $18 for an oyster that was overpowered by the XO sauce, the arctic char did not seem as fresh as it could be and as it was cooked (slightly undercooked) it was even more evident; the fluke crudo was my favorite on the menu and the Vesper Martini is a must try!  I truly hope it was an off-night for the team so may come back and try again since the experience was amazing.

text.text: The new restaurant by Marcus Samuelsson is definitely a worthwhile destination for a beautiful meal. The atmosphere, presentation of the food and cocktail menu was phenomenal. I truly hope it was an off-night for the team so may come back and try again since the experience was amazing.

originalText.text: The mashed potatoes side dish that comes with the short rib, was NEXT LEVEL, life changing. Everything was really good, the services was really good, I just wish it wasn’t so out in the open but the food can let me look pass that. The best food I’ve had in a long time and I just went to Torrisi.

text.text: The mashed potatoes side dish that comes with the short rib, was NEXT LEVEL, life changing. Everything was really good, the services was really good, I just wish it wasn’t so out in the open but the food can let me look pass that. The best food I’ve had in a long time and I just went to Torrisi.

originalText.text: Excellent quality yum dishes. Service is spot on and beyond, though one friendly server was not well versed on the menu or cocktails. Hamachi smoked taco and the grapefruit granite panacotta is a must but everything we had was very good. Window seating was set up but told no one can sit there. Banquet 2 people seating is comfortable, but one person will be facing the wall and missing the people watching and the ambiance. Seating near the bar is better than farther back. Can't wait to come back!

text.text: Excellent quality yum dishes. Service is spot on and beyond, though one friendly server was not well versed on the menu or cocktails. Banquet 2 people seating is comfortable, but one person will be facing the wall and missing the people watching and the ambiance. Seating near the bar is better than farther back. Can't wait to come back!

originalText.text:
Love love love this place. First off, the brand new P.A.C. center is absolutely gorgeous. The decor is exquisite, both inside and outside of the building. The restaurant, Metropolis itself, has a very modern rustic vibe. It's like the 70s, and today's modern design had a baby, and that baby is Metropolis.

As beautiful as the decor is. The food is delectable art. Chef Ed Tinoco and Chef Marcus Samuelson have truly put together a masterful menu that is certainly to any palate.

Another big shout out to the entire beverage team. Their wine list is extremely sophisticated and worldly. Some incredible selections at perfect price points from all over the world! More countries are represented than I have seen on a list in a long time. Their cocktail list is uniquely special, and you can tell how hand crafted the beverages have been created. They even have an insane non-alcoholic specialty drink list for those who still want to try something new.

As for food, I wish I could try the entire menu. My guest had the Montauk Fluke Crudo, which was stunning to look at as they truly enjoyed it. I myself had the Smoked Hamachi Taco, which was out of this world. (See video) The house made belini-tacos infused with basil oil were the perfect vessels for the Hamachi. It perfectly wrapped the fish as I made my taco table side. Truly creates a perfect bite. Sweet, salty, crunchy, savory, and Umami. BRAVO!!!

For entrée, my guest had the Arctic Char with an uni beurre blanc, and I couldn't decide because I wanted EVERYTHING.... I closed my eyes and blindly pointed to the duck.
My guest was overjoyed with the luxuriously delicate flavors of the sea. I mean... come on, people... what's not to love when an UNI BEURRE BLANC is involved.
When my dish arrived, I took a second to appreciate the time spent perfecting this dish. The duck was exquisitely cooked. The knife cut through it like butter as the perfectly crispy skin cracked within each succulent bite. I haven't even gotten into the Molé, or even the side of duck confit!!! Take me to flavor town! And if you thought that was it, think again, because this dish wouldn't be complete in its decadence without a nice piece of foie Gras..... and game over! Please send me home with a side of that molé sauce so I can bathe in it! A Homerun of a dish in my book.

For dessert,  my guest and I shared their bacon caramel flan....

Yes....

That's right.

A Bacon caramel Flan!

Do I even need to explain any more???
Go to Metropolis NOW and try it for yourself!

@ericjordan03oninstagram
